intro: Rosa viscaria var. stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited dog玫瑰, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of fragrant, pinkish-white flowers. The leaves are trifoliate, with three leaflets that are oval to elliptical in shape. The plant is notable for its narrow, elongated fruits, which are typically covered in fine, hooked hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
